node.title: 'Dying like flies. It's a catastrophe': The country where COVID-19 deaths are surging
node.description: An independent demographer said he expected average life expectancy to fall from 2019 levels of just above 73 years to about 69 years as a result of the pandemic.
node.content: ["Russia's already high COVID-19 mortality rate might be dramatically under-reported after the Financial Times released figures that showed deaths could be over three times higher.\u00a0", "Russia's inter-agency coronavirus task force attributed 203,549 deaths to the disease at the end of September, which is significantly lower than the number the Financial Times is reporting.\u00a0", "They have found 753,000 people have died from COVID-19 which would put them second globally just slightly behind the USA who have had 775,204 COVID-19 deaths.\u00a0", "The Financial Times calculated their figure by the number of excess deaths. Excess deaths were calculated by comparing the number of total deaths recorded for any reason during the pandemic and comparing that with historical death trends in Russia prior to the pandemic.", "While the task force, receives daily updates from hospitals on cases where Covid-19 was the evident primary cause of death, with no closer examinations.", "The coronavirus death toll is a hotly debated topic. President Vladimir Putin, warned regional authorities not to \"artificially lower\" or \"embellish\" the figures.", "Russia's national coronavirus task force has reported more than 1,100 COVID-19 deaths each day for the past week.", "\"There's a tradition of blaming everything on the government,\" Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said according to TASS news. \"And, of course, not everything was done that should've been, in terms of communicating the importance of vaccination and the lack of alternatives.\"\u00a0", "\"At the same time, a more responsible position on the part of all citizens of the country is needed too.\"", "One obvious reason for the high number of COVID-19 deaths in Russia is down to the sluggish uptake in Russia's vaccination campaign.\u00a0", "\"The population acts as if it has no idea, or it doesn't care any more, while people have started dying like flies. It's a catastrophe,\" said independent demographer Alexey Raksha.", "He said he expected average life expectancy to fall from 2019 levels of just above 73 years to about 69 years as a result of the pandemic.", "The vaccine is only approved for use in people over the age of 18 and, according to the website Gogov, which collects and publishes vaccination data from across the country, just 41 per cent of adults in Russia have received two doses."]
